text:p.text:span: Input text files that contain the project parameters and describe the flow control of the build process in simple CMake language.

text:list-item.text:p: This creates the variables projectname_BINARY_DIR and projectname_SOURCE_DIR.
Set the minimum required version of cmake for a project.
Arguments are passed to compiler (like CFLAGS)

text:p.text:span: - 10 most useful functions for 90% of projects

text:list-item.text:p: cmake -D <var>:<type>=<value> # define variable and store in cache

text:p.text:span: GUI can be used to change values
There should be no need to edit it manually!!
Out-of-source build used to separate build files from sources. Very useful for multi-platform development.
Change to a build directory and give path to the sources as argument:

Special cmake file written for the purpose of finding a certain piece of software and to set it's libraries, include files and definitions into appropriate variables so that they can be used in the build process of another project. (e.g. FindJava.cmake, FindZLIB.cmake, FindQt4.cmake)
# adjust the default behaviour of the FIND_XXX() commands:
Path to where the CMake modules are located
Where to put files when calling 'make install'
Switch between shared and static libraries
Variables can be changed directly in the build files (CmakeLists.txt) or through the command line by prefixing a variable's name with '
Child inherits from parent (feature that is lacking in traditional Makefiles)
(When CMake finds a SUBDIR command it stops processing the current file immediately and goes down the tree branch)
convert space separated string to list
target1 depends on t2 and t3
All targets link with the same set of libs
Very useful: IF( APPLE ); IF( UNIX ); IF( WIN32 )
Regular expressions (check CMake FAQ for details...)
